title: Higher ping in several locations, several different connections in Ohio
body: Hi, so I've been playing League at 29ping stable, as have my friends that live near me, but all of a sudden the ping is steady 58-65 for all us. This has been tested on three different connections from three different areas in Ohio. Is this a permanent thing now or are the servers experiencing some stress/lag?

replies.body:
This is most likely caused by either ISP routing or issues along a backbone prior to your connection hitting the server. I recommend running a traceroute log, which will give us insight as to where there may be issues along your route.

I recommend doing this with the [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net) application with the IP address 104.160.131.1 and starting the trace. After the trace has run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them here. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PII3VIUr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-15T23:56:21.678+0000)
>
> This is most likely caused by either ISP routing or issues along a backbone prior to your connection hitting the server. I recommend running a traceroute log, which will give us insight as to where there may be issues along your route.
> 
> I recommend doing this with the [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net) application with the IP address 104.160.131.1 and starting the trace. After the trace has run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them here. 
> 
> Let me know if you have any questions.

I'm actually not home right now, so am unable to run WinMTR and give you the requested information. However, I've noticed something weird. All of our pings have been around 60 stable at night time, but while playing yesterday at around 4:30am all of our pings went back down to 40.  So our ping is only that high at certain times of day. Obviously it's not a seperate internet issue because all of my friends in Ohio are encountering the same issue and the ping is stable. I just find it a little weird because it randomly started happening just three days ago. We all have the same ISP, Time Warner Cable. 

Anyways, I'll get you the requested information asap. Thanks for responding.

Your traceroute shows the latency inside your network spikes up to 2402ms and continues to remain in the 2400's across your entire route to the server. This is an indication that there may be issues with your Hitron modem, and if simply resetting it doesn't resolve the problem, you'll want to reach out to your ISP tech support about this. Specifically requesting a **tier 2 support agent** and providing them these traceroute results should be enough context for them to launch an investigation.

Let me know if you have any questions.
